mosinstall.name: Latest Events
mosinstall.author: JEvents Project Group
mosinstall.description: Show latest events for Events component

param.name: cache
param.label: Enable Cache
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable), this allows individual module styling

param.name: catid0
param.label: Specified category
param.description: Shows events only from the selected category

param.name: catid1
param.label: Additional category
param.description: Also include events from this additional category

param.name: catid2
param.label: Additional category
param.description: Also include events from this additional category

param.name: catid3
param.label: Additional category
param.description: Also include events from this additional category

param.name: catid4
param.label: Additional category
param.description: Also include events from this additional category

param.name: modlatest_inccss
param.label: Include Events Latest CSS
param.description: Tells the module if the module Events Latest CSS should be included or not. This is not recommended - you are better off putting a copy of the CSS in your template_css.css file

param.name: modlatest_useLocalParam
param.label: Use parameter
param.description: Use parameter defined global in component or defined here

param.name: modlatest_CustFmtStr
param.label: Custom Format String
param.description: allows a customized specification of the desired event fields and format to be used to display the event in the module. The string can specify html directly. As well, certain event fields can be specified as ${event_field} in the string. For a detailed information follow the help button on the modules tab page at the components configuration

param.name: modlatest_MaxEvents
param.label: Maximum Events to Display
param.description: Maximum number of events to display in the module(max 150)

param.name: modlatest_Mode
param.label: Display Mode
param.description:
= 0 (default) display closest events for current week and following week only up to maxEvents.
= 1 same as 0 except some past events for the current week will also be displayed if num of future events is less than maxEvents.
= 2 display closest events for +days range relative to current day up to maxEvents.
= 3 same as mode 2 except if there are < maxEvents in the range, then display past events within -days range relative to current day.
= 4 display closest events for current month up to maxEvents relative to current day.

param.name: modlatest_Days
param.label: Display Events the of the next ? days(modes 1 or 3 only)
param.description: range of days relative to current day to display events for mode 1 or 3.

param.name: modlatest_NoRepeat
param.label: Display a Repeating Event Once
param.description: display any event which has a repeat type only once in the latest events output.

param.name: modlatest_DispLinks
param.label: Display Events As Links
param.description: display event titles as links to the view_detail com_events task which will display details of the event

param.name: modlatest_DispYear
param.label: Display the Year in the Events Date (default format only)
param.description: Display the Year in the Events Date (default format only)

param.name: modlatest_DisDateStyle
param.label: Disable default CSS Date Field Style
param.description: do not apply the default mod_events_latest_date css class to the date field

param.name: modlatest_DisTitleStyle
param.label: Disable default CSS Title Field Style
param.description: do not apply the default mod_events_latest_content css class to the title field

param.name: modlatest_LinkCloaking
param.label: Hide Links
param.description: If set to YES, links are set dynamically by the javascript onclick event. This prevents search enginges to follow the links

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Advanced Settings
param.description: The following settings are for advanced users only

param.label: Target Menu Itemid
param.description: Menu itemid for target page
